Posts.Content: Oct 12, 2013 05:36AM glorianna wrote: Dear Melissa, I had an ovarian cyst 6cm misses by the gyn 2 years ago. My hospital journal says, pathology report has anamenes of ovarian tumour. Radiation for cancer is mentioned 2 times on opex day. I had 15! U.S images taken, that day, 5 liyomyomas, one smoothe muscle mass, via 2nd look pathology, not complete with any immunochem. staining I have no final diagnos. Just bleeding!! I met an oncology gyn surgeon at the Milano Istituto Tumori Cancer Hospital, and I showed him the image of this tumor. He confirmed it was a tumor, and my path.report said nothing at all. He will review it again, with stainging for receptors and other numbers as this has never been done. One leioyomyoma has nuclear atypia etc but it requires new very detailed pathology?slicing. He told me I may have a STUMP tumor. Many features of my pathology was incorrect, even mitotic activity missed. I have just found I have a lung nodule, and a visit again via the livertumor conference. The tumor disrupted fluid in my abdomen during opex. Right now, I faxed my pathology report to the highest medical authority in Sweden, and they gave directly me a reviewer who wll demand in all journals fr the hospitals and imaging firm. As it is the state, all citizens will be able to view this case, including my personal gyn journals!!! Atnother lady in my age died, after being misdiagnosed for a gyn cyst which was ovarian tumor, the path. guy worked at the same hospital I had opex in. It has been on TV that 2 pathologists have misdiagnosed cancer patients. How are you coping after your tumor? God bless you! - you must have been thru alot and seem so strong! Wish you the best!

Posts.Content: glorianna wrote: Hi, As a total newbie, I did many hours of internet trying to understand, due to pet ct scan did yesterday showing activity in 4 cm lump, 2.5 cm area of FDG, and planned lumpecomy with frozen section and SNB, done duriing surgery. Conversions of lumpectomy to mastecomy if needed. My hard papable lump, with profilerative papilloma has an inner structure in a cyst thing, that cannot be reached with multiple CNBs. Say, if the lumpectomy margins show BC down to the rib where I have great pain, since 6 months and MRI biopsies done, showing strange older bleeding. Are relevant axiilla nodes or SNB nodes removed at the same time as surgery? Optimal thing would be to take all cancer stuff away at the same time, including nodes. Many ladies seem to have relevant nodes missed by the surgeon. All nodes not taken. I had rich amounts of transformations in my whole skelletton pelvis after total hysterectomy, and none of these transformations were sampled for biopsy. The gyn surgeon, non oncologi surgeon, she had taken all suspicious stuff away. My pathology report of the opereation and specimens removed show the promises samples were not taken. Due to heavy adhesions, in the gyn, abdo. area, no one dares go in with laparoscopi to take new samples, risking perforation of colons. The health authoritey are going to check this up, but making a claim, will risk that future bad treatlment will be done, by collegues, as we have a joined medical journal thing, so the whole country can see you prior treatment. My woman gyn surgeon told me I was cured. In ermergency room I was told I have fluid in my hysterecomy wound, intraabdominal!  take care Log in to post a reply
